column4: Here's the terminal: eric@livingroom2:~/My Projects/cpp/src$ gcc -o ..\bin\hello Hello.cpp
/tmp/ccyoEXb8.o: In function `main':
Hello.cpp:(.text+0x1c): undefined reference to `std::cout'

http://paste.ubuntu.com/189323/ this is the terminal command and output
you might ask in #gcc or #c++
what are you trying to do in audacity
I'm trying to combine two .wav files into one, but when I export my project, the .wav file it saves is broken. Help?
do you have any idea what might be wrong?
my first thought is you don't have the appropriate debs loaded to do audiofile manipulation
What debs do you think I need, and where can I find them? Also, .wav is the only file format that doesn't work.
did you catch my response?
in Synaptic .. search for wav and install the actual wave plugins/drivers ... not sure what they all are called ... work with the discriptions
I can play any other .wav just fine. It's just this one that doesn't work.
I think I'm just not saving it correctly or something. Any idea?
er um ... not really ... make sure you have the right encoders and such .. not sure how well audacity works with wav
thanks anyway...
